f6_assessments.q0: This proposal gave a general description of the project’s functions. But in my opinion, you should focus more on the benefits that Cardano enthusiasts, who are the target users, will gain from playing this crafting-game which is considered as a great idea to improve the traction in Cardano adopters and gamers. Likewise, you had better explain the extent of rareness of the Beer-NFT's by providing a specific number of this. For example, you can state “this NFT is of great value because we will only supply 10,000,000 in total”. Moreover, upon announcing that you are aiming to provide real utility with your NFT's (this key metric matches with that of the challenge), I advise you to specify this feature, as well as the amount of value that gamers can make in this play-to-earn app. I can’t deny the quality tooling of your application since your team is capable of creating a full 3D-environment for gamers to walk around and manually initiate every step of the brewing process, which is viewed as an enjoyable technology to help users engage on. Concerning the obstacles, you had better identify clearly what problems about coding and deployment of smart contracts you can encounter in the future of project conducting.rather than giving a general announcement like:“Risks more or less depend on our ability to keep up with the latest developments”. If you want to deliver this project successfully, find a practicable solution to them, such as investing more money into the servers to get rid of bugs, etc instead of claiming that you already have two software developers to be in charge of.
f6_assessments.q1: The central point in this section is a detailed work plan with enough timeline for delivering the proposed solution. However, it can be seen obviously that you aren’t able to hand in an explicit milestones and timeframe to achieve them. For instance, you have to estimate as precisely as possible when the Plutus pioneer program will be launched, when smart contracts, technical features, ingredients and beer types will be developed, in which month or in which quarter of the year. These data are a prerequisite for the voters and community to follow the active progress of your project. Similarly, this proposal also provided no detailed cost breakdown. I understand your team has to pay a salary for members and operating fees to other deliverables, but the case is how much it is. If you can’t at least allot necessary fees to each activity, how could the voters mark your proposal as good, right? Another crucial point is the detail of team members. I’m sorry to say the following, but your proposal is one of the worst ones when taking this section into account. Your team has six workers in total, so you have to show the voters who they are (of course including their names), how many years they have dedicate to the relevant field, what they obtained during their career, and even better, you could show the links of their LinkedIn profiles so that the voters can capture enough information of your team and assess their potential.
f6_assessments.q2: With regards to this auditability section, it is readily apparent that no certain measurement tools are provided in this proposal. Technically, how to keep track of the operability of the smart contracts and the 3D-environment? Please find a straightforward answer to this question clearly with a view to helping the community supervise the progression of your deliverables. In the same way, you state that your project goal is full operationality for players, which is also your way of defining success. Yet, you still don’t shed light on this content, for example, I can’t figure out what items this full operationality will contain and how useful they will be for players. For that reason, I strongly believe that this proposal would be better assessed if you can supplement extra information to improve its shortcomings that I suggested.

f6_assessments.q0: My initial reaction to this project is excitement, since I’ve literally never stumbled on the idea of owning a 3D brewery inside a cryptocurrency blockchain. So this could both offer players a first time being a brewer and owning a business as well, and from the looks of it, the game tries to resemble every single step of the way. The proposal also includes a possible problem, which seems to be keeping up to date with technology nowadays, and fortunately there comes a viable resolution for that. However, even though the proposal delivers plenty of the functions and features of the game, there seems to be no mention of a main target audience. One could speculate that this aims towards the gaming community, still I’d like a confirmation on the proposer’s part. Another flaw to this proposal that I notice is the missing of core metrics used to approximately measure the initial success of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: This section, in my opinion, is not carefully delivered. For now, it would seem like there is no plan or milestones just yet, only an estimation of a time period, there is neither an exact number for the requested budget nor its breakdown (though we do know what it’s for) and a very brief listings of current team members as there is information regarding background or expertise whatsoever.
f6_assessments.q2: This is another section that suffers from the lack of relevant information. For instance, even though the team claims that they have had milestones to keep track of the progress, they haven’t specified what exactly those are. Furthermore, there is no utilization of tools that enable the team and the community to monitor more conveniently, such as GitHub, ClickUp or Trello. And I must add that not only is there no mention of the benefits and profits that Cardano can expect to gain from this project whatsoever, apparently the team doesn’t have 100% faith in the potential of their own spiritual child.

f6_assessments.q0:
With YeastBrothers the team wants to bring utility to NFTs and create a fun game for beer enthusiasts. The proposal does not really address how new gamers will be onboarded onto the blockchain but rather explains the game functionalities. Current challenges are that traditional gamers are unfamiliar with blockchain technology and often perceive NFT games as scam. In addition, the entry barrier for these games can be quite high as players need to invest in sometimes expensive NFTs. The proposal does not indicate how these problems would be addressed and seems to be rather geared for blockchain familiar gamers. 

Overall, the game proposed here is very niche-oriented (beer enthusiasts) and does not provide a particular solution of how new gamers could be attracted to the Cardano ecosystem. As this is in principle “just another NFT game” I don’t think this proposal addresses the challenge well.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, no detailed roadmap and timeline was provided. As no concrete plan was outlined, it is difficult to assess whether this proposal can be implanted successfully. Although the author seems to have experience in this space (creator of a previous CNFT game), the proposal indicates that more developers will be required. The requested funds will be used to pay these developers, but a detailed budget breakdown is missing. Additionally, I strongly assume that the requested funds (6.5k USD) will be not enough to pay 5 employees for 4 months (estimated duration to finish the project). Altogether, I don’t think this proposal can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: In the proposal it is stated that clear milestones have been set, but unfortunately, they are not included. It would have been good to indicate those in the proposal and provide details. Without any milestones specified and no clear plan and work packages, it is almost impossible to audit the developmental progress of the project. A Github page is provided but no information is outlined whether code commits can be followed on there. No success metrics or KPIs are given, making it again impossible to assess the success of the proposal. I strongly advise the author to edit the proposal and include more details on roadmap/timeline, deliverables, milestones and KPIs.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims at creating a virtual brewery and let the players craft their own beers in this virtual world, by using NFT ingredients. Their 3D virtual world will be as close as possible to a real brewery, and they players will be able to manually start all steps of the process. They mention they their tokens will have real utility, but it’s not clear if there’s something else besides crafting virtual beers. This is a game that, for me, would attract only the most enthusiasts beer fans, I don’t think it is so appealing to have a huge base of players, specially recurrent since after some time it would become a bit repetitive, even with different recipes. Therefore, I don’t see it as having a huge impact in the ecosystem. The risks that were mentioned here are related only to the development of the game itself, which they mention will be solved due to their 2 devs that are closely following all the updates related to smart contracts, but the main risk for me is actually attracting and keep players in their community.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposing team doesn’t inform a roadmap or timeline. They only stated that the execution would take 4 months, and they depend on Plutus Pioneers Program which is currently under way. I don’t believe this is a good reasoning because the schedule of Plutus Pioneers is well known, and the timeline could be prepared anyways, but without specifying a start date, for example. Without this, it’s not possible to know how feasible the plan is. The budget is not broken down as well, they just say that it would be used to pay 2 devs, but don’t mention how long each of them would work, what’s the hourly cost they are considering, or basically any other information about the budget. In the team section, they provide the number of members but don’t provide any details about them, or links to check the background. Also, the team members include 5 people, but they are only paying for 2 devs, which doesn’t sum up.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers mention they have set clear milestones, but they don’t mention what they are. They don’t provide any information about how we could keep track of their progress as well, and what kind of reports they would provide to IOG or to the community. They even say that they won’t they in case they are not successful, which is also not good, they should have a risk management plan or something similar. They didn’t provide information about any previous funded proposals as well. I’d advise the team, in case of re-application, to read Catalyst documentation and guidelines, so they can include all the necessary information into the proposal and have better chances of being funded next Fund.

Proposal itself seems interesting and could have OK potential, but at this stage it is not 100% clear how it will fulfill it's purpose. How will you collect ingredinets needed to create beer? Will you buy it? Just a structured and better brake-down is all that is needed to make better evaluation.
f6_assessments.q1: At this point I would have to say that it lacks sufficient information to be able to evaluate if this proposal will succeed. There is concept of the beer creating game available, but how will it be further developed? At what timeline? What are milestones? Just to name few uncertainties from my side. In general, concept seems to be interesting and has potential, just needs to be better structured and planned.
f6_assessments.q2: Not fully clear at this point. There are somethings available, but as mentioned there are no clear timelines. This makes it difficult to audit the progress of the proposal. The budget requested is not fully explained for what it will be used. A detailed brake down would be appreciated and make this proposal much better.
